_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Note:   2008  Facility De Registered, Dis Assembled, Removed from Service

Crystal Valley Co-op
301 W. Mabel
Mankato, Mn.  56001

For further information contact: Mark Wels, Safety Director
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

1. The Facility Policy

     The owners, management, and employees of Crystal Valley Co-op are committed to the prevention of
any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
     -The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers.
Anhydrous Ammonia is received, stored, and disributed for both direct application to farmers.The
maximum quantity stored would be 240000 pounds in the 12000 and the 18000 gal storage tanks,
also including nurse tanks.

 

3. "Worst-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario: This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Su

mmary as security sensitive information as requested by EPA."



4.  The accidental release prevention program.
     The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of 
     Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published be The American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the
     standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111,
     "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia."

5.  The Five-year Accident History
     There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have 
     caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge,
     have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, or environmental damage.

6.  The Emergency Response program.
     A. The facility has

a.  A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard,29 CFR 1910.38
b.  Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information
     as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);
c.  Coordinated with local emergency responders.


7.   Planned changes to improve safety.
      Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to 
      assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no specific anhydrous ammonia safety 
      recommendations for implementation at this time.

     MARK WELS
     Safety Director.
